story.iWant: a complete design token system configured in Tailwind
story.soThat: I can build consistent UI components using the FitForge design system
story.tasks: - Create src/design-system/tokens/colors.ts for programmatic color access - Create src/design-system/tokens/typography.ts for typography scales - Create src/design-system/tokens/spacing.ts for 8px grid system - Create src/design-system/tokens/shadows.ts for shadow definitions - Verify tailwind.config.js contains all required tokens (from 5-1) - Create test component demonstrating all tokens - Verify WCAG AA contrast compliance for all color combinations - Document token usage patterns

story-context.acceptanceCriteria: - AC1: Primary color palette configured (#758AC6, #344161, #566890, #8997B8, #A8B6D5) - AC2: Badge colors configured (#D9E1F8 bg, #BFCBEE border, #566890 text) - AC3: Typography scale configured (display-xl, display-lg, display-md with Cinzel specs) - AC4: Shadow tokens configured (button-primary, drawer) - AC5: Background gradients configured (heavenly-gradient) - AC6: Border radius tokens configured (xl: 24px, 2xl: 32px) - AC7: All tokens accessible via Tailwind classes (e.g., bg-primary, text-primary-dark) - AC8: Color contrast verified for WCAG AA compliance
